page.title: 19Rest Home For Horses
page.content: The Rest Home for Horses in Whitchurch provides a quiet,peaceful home for 120 donkeys,ponies and horses during their retirement.Animals come from different backgrounds and for different reasons. Three old pit ponies who had worked in the South Wales Collieries are enjoying a well earned retirement. Bloom,used to draw the Lord Mayor of Bristol's carriage,whereas Mike pulled a gypsy caravan.A piebald,named Tiny, found a home at Whitchurch after a spinal injury.Three donkeys from Weymouth sands,Beau,Noggin and Pepper aged 20- 24 years now live in Whitchurch.The Rest Home for Horse is open to the general public on Sunday mornings.Income obtained from fund raising events,such as the Summer Fete and the Christmas carol concert held in the stables,contribute to the success of this venture.
